alert.note: Alert for Western Grant (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 26 at 1:33PM EST until January 27 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Westerly winds gusting around 40 mph. * WHERE...In Maryland, Garrett County. In West Virginia, Western Grant County. * WHEN...Through 4 AM EST Friday. Snow will continue through tonight. Heavier snow showers and perhaps a snow squall are possible this afternoon and evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of strong winds and heavier bursts of snow will cause visibility to be locally reduced below one-quarter mile at times.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
